Class Student

  • java.lang.Object
    • SchoolMember
      • Student
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FullTimeStudent, PartTimeStudent
    public class Student
extends SchoolMember
    This class represents a student of a school.
    Version:
    8th September, 2018

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String[] courses
      This represents the course names of the courses taken by the student.
      private int[] grades
      This represents grades obtained in the corresponding courses.
      private static int MAX_CREDITS
      This represents the maximum number of credits allowed(20)
      private static int MAX_NUMBER_OF_COURSES
      This represents the maximum number of courses allowed(4)
      protected int minCredits
      This represents the minimum number of credits.
      private int numCourses
      This represents the number of courses taken so far.
      private int numCredits
      This represents the number of credits taken so far.
      private static int REQUIRED_PERCENTAGE_FOR_PROMOTION
      This represents the required average grade for promotion(75)

      Constructor for objects of class Student.

      This method aims to add the grade for a particular course.

      This method tells whether there are enough course slots left to fill.

      This method tells whether the student has exceeded the maximum credits allowed.
      int getAverageGrade()
      This method provides the average of all the grades and sets the chanceOfPromotion variable.

      This method returns the min credits.
      int getNumberOfCourses()
      This method returns the number of courses.
      boolean isRegistrationSuccessful()
      This method tells whether registration was successful.
      int promoted()
      This method tells whether a student can be promoted or not.
      boolean registerCourse​(java.lang.String course, int credit)
      This method aims to register a student for a course.
      boolean removeCourse​(java.lang.String course)
      This method is used to remove a course from the registered courses.
      After removing the course, the number of courses should be reduced.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method overrides the default toString method to print name and address in the form "Student: name (address)"
      For example, Name = Jesse, Address = 9809 Margo Street,
      the string returned should be "Student: Jesse (9809 Margo Street)"

    • Constructor Detail

      • Student

        public Student​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String address)
        Constructor for objects of class Student. Variables name and address are initialised using the base class's constructor. Initialise numCourses to 0 and create arrays courses and grades of size MAX_NUMBER_OF_COURSES. Default value for minCredits is 10.
        Parameters:
        name - specifies the name of the person
        address - specifies the address of the person

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method overrides the default toString method to print name and address in the form "Student: name (address)"
        For example, Name = Jesse, Address = 9809 Margo Street,
        the string returned should be "Student: Jesse (9809 Margo Street)"
        Overrides:
        toString in class SchoolMember
        Returns:
        Returns the above specified string

      • registerCourse

        public boolean registerCourse​(java.lang.String course,
                              int credit)
        This method aims to register a student for a course. A student can successfully register only if he has enough course slots left and does not exceed his maximum allowed credits and if he has not already registered for the course before.
        Parameters:
        course - specifies the name of the course
        credit - specifies the credits for the course
        Returns:
        Returns true if student successfully registered for course, otherwise returns false

      • isRegistrationSuccessful

        public boolean isRegistrationSuccessful()
        This method tells whether registration was successful. Registration is successful when the person has taken the correct number of required courses and when credits taken are between prescribed limits.
        Returns:
        Returns true if student registration is successful, otherwise false

      • addGrades

        public boolean addGrades​(java.lang.String course,
                         int grade)
        This method aims to add the grade for a particular course. For the corresponding course, the grade should be added at the corresponding location.
        For example, if "ML" couse is at position 2 in courses array, the grade passed for "ML" course should be updated at position 2 of grades array.
        Parameters:
        course - specifies the course whose grade should be updated
        grade - specifies the grade for the course
        Returns:
        Returns true if the grade was successfully added, else returns false

      • enoughCourseSlots

        private boolean enoughCourseSlots()
        This method tells whether there are enough course slots left to fill.
        Returns:
        Returns true if enough course slots are left to fill, otherwise false

      • exceedsMaxCredits

        private boolean exceedsMaxCredits​(int credit)
        This method tells whether the student has exceeded the maximum credits allowed.
        Parameters:
        credit - specifies the credits
        Returns:
        Returns true if maximum credits exceeded, otherwise false

      • getAverageGrade

        public int getAverageGrade()
        This method provides the average of all the grades and sets the chanceOfPromotion variable. If no courses are present, average grade is 100.
        Returns:
        Returns average of grades

      • promoted

        public int promoted()
        This method tells whether a student can be promoted or not. A student can be promoted if his chanceOfPromotion satisfies the minimum percentage required
        Overrides:
        promoted in class SchoolMember
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if the student can be promoted, otherwise 0

      • removeCourse

        public boolean removeCourse​(java.lang.String course)
        This method is used to remove a course from the registered courses.
        After removing the course, the number of courses should be reduced.
        Parameters:
        course - specifies the course to be removed
        Returns:
        Returns true if course removal was successful, otherwise false

      • getMinCredits

        public int getMinCredits()
        This method returns the min credits.
        Returns:
        Returns the min credits

      • getNumberOfCourses

        public int getNumberOfCourses()
        This method returns the number of courses.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of courses
